title: Olivia Attwood offered ‘six figure’ deal for Trashy clothing line
text:
Olivia Attwood has reportedly signed the big-money deal for her new range (Picture: WireImage)

Former Love Island star Olivia Attwood has apparently been offered a ‘six figure’ sum to start her own clothing line since starring in The Only Way Is Essex.

The reality star, 28, has apparently been approached by clothing companies to bring out a line called Trashy, after she was labelled ‘trashy and unclassy’ by fellow cast member Courtney Green during an on-screen argument last month.

A source explained: ‘She’s been a huge success and it is no surprise that companies are banging down her door to collaborate,’ they told The Sun.

‘She’s not up for everything – but releasing her own fashion line was too good an offer and she couldn’t turn it down.

‘Olivia loves the Trashy name. One of the Towie girls called her trashy and said she wasn’t high end enough for the show, but this is Olivia owning her image. Olivia feels empowered by the name!’

Olivia recently announced her engagement to Bradley Dack (Picture: Instagram)

Olivia has certainly caused a stir since joining Towie, and her feud with Courtney also shows no signs of abating, as she even threw olives at her in scenes which weren’t aired on the show.

She also announced her engagement to boyfriend Bradley Dack on Monday, telling her followers: ‘He must be crazy… Here’s to forever . I love you BD.’

Olivia isn’t the only former Love Island contestant who has bagged a big money deal with a clothing retailer this year – 2019’s winner Amber Gill signed a £1million deal with Miss Pap and Molly Mae Hague reportedly got £500,000 from PrettyLittleThing for her collab.

ASOS signed up resident heartthrob Ovie Soko and his father for a range, while Maura Higgins has signed partnerships with boohoo and Ann Summers.
